items.title: De beste wensen voor 2026
items.summary: Voetbal International wenst u een mooi, sportief en voorspoedig 2026. Een jaar waarin wij met de grootste voetbalredactie van Nederland weer op elk moment van de dag u maximaal naar wens voorzien van alle ontwikkelingen in het voetballandschap.

items.title: Madrid's Mbapp√© (knee) doubtful for Supercopa
items.summary: Kylian Mbapp√© will miss Real Madrid's LaLiga game with Real Betis and is a doubt for next week's Spanish Supercopa, sources have told ESPN, due to a knee injury.

items.title: Holders Ivory Coast rally to win group at AFCON
items.summary: Defending Africa Cup of Nations champions Ivory Coast came from two goals down to defeat Gabon 3-2 in their final Group F fixture in Marrakesh on Wednesday, qualifying them as group winners to set up a round of 16 showdown with Burkina Faso.

items.title: Modric: Mourinho at Madrid 'made Ronaldo cry'
items.summary: Croatia and AC Milan midfielder Luka Modric said on Wednesday that Jose Mourinho was such a tough manager during their time at Real Madrid that he once reduced star player Cristiano Ronaldo to tears.

items.summary: Manager praises his team‚Äôs turnaround in past 12 months January arrivals also hailed for making a key difference Pep Guardiola has praised Manchester City for turning their form around to become the best-performing Premier League team in 2025 and warned rivals they will improve once Rodri returns to full fitness. Despite a rare trophyless season, City go to Sunderland on New Year‚Äôs Day with 2025‚Äôs best points-per-game ratio, narrowly ahead of Arsenal, who played two more league matches. items.title: 'Vroege' CL-finale en gekortwiekte play-offs: 10 belangrijke voetbaldata in 2026
items.summary: Met een XXL-WK voor de deur wordt het sowieso een bijzonder voetbaljaar. VI zet alvast tien belangrijke data in 2026 op een rij.

items.title: Ivoorkust na fraaie comeback groepswinnaar op Afrika Cup
items.summary: Het al geplaatste Ivoorkust heeft zich woensdag tijdens de laatste duels in Groep F de kaas van het brood laten eten door het al uitgeschakelde Gabon. De titelverdediger moet daardoor voorrang verlenen aan Kameroen, dat geen fout maakte tegen Mozambique.

items.title: Wintertransfers Eredivisie seizoen 2025/26: alle clubs op een rij
items.summary: De transferperiode is weer losgebarsten. In dit overzicht van VI vind je alle afgeronde, door clubs bevestigde, wintertransfers van de achttien Eredivisie-clubs. Clubs in Nederland kunnen tot en met 3 februari spelers aantrekken.

items.title: Afcon roundup: C√¥te d‚ÄôIvoire pip Cameroon with dramatic win over Gabon
items.summary: Holders come from two goals down to win 3-2 Burkina Faso beat Sudan as both sides progress C√¥te d‚ÄôIvoire came from two goals down to beat already eliminated Gabon 3-2 in Group F at the Africa Cup of Nations on Wednesday as the teenager Bazoumana Tour√©‚Äôs headed winner in added time in Marrakech handed them top spot. The Ivorians finished on seven points from their three games, ahead of Cameroon on goals scored after the latter beat third-placed Mozambique. Gabon were ahead on 11 minutes when Gu√©lor Kanga profited from a mistake from the goalkeeper Alban Lafont as he spilled a tame shot, allowing the forward to score from close range. It was 2-0 on 21 minutes and this time Lafont had no chance. Denis Bouanga curled a superb shot from the left-hand side of the box across the goal and into the far corner. Continue reading...

items.title: Seven questions Liverpool must answer in the transfer window
items.summary: The January transfer window opens soon, and top clubs like Liverpool have big and expensive decisions to make.

items.title: What should Man United do in January?
items.summary: There are plenty of big decisions to be made at Old Trafford, including concerning manager Ruben Amorim.

items.title: Dit is het schema van de achtste finale van de Afrika Cup
items.summary: In slechts elf dagen tijd is de groepsfase van de Afrika Cup afgewerkt. Na twee rustdagen gaat het toernooi zaterdag verder met de achtste finale. We zetten de wedstrijden op een rij.

items.title: Enzo Maresca at risk of Chelsea sack if poor run persists with a dry January
items.summary: ‚ÄòWorst 48 hours‚Äô comment and league form are problems Palmer substitution and Bournemouth result were booed Enzo Maresca will be in danger of losing his job as Chelsea‚Äôs head coach if he cannot improve results before the end of January. The Italian, who was booed by home supporters during the disappointing 2-2 draw with Bournemouth at Stamford Bridge on Tuesday, is under mounting pressure after a poor run of form, and a series of self-inflicted wounds have raised doubts over his position. Chelsea have one win from their past seven league games and although Maresca is set to be in charge for Sunday‚Äôs trip to Manchester City his position is increasingly uncertain. Concern over the 45-year-old‚Äôs decisions during games and away from the pitch have grown in recent weeks and there can be no guarantee that Maresca will survive beyond the end of January if he proves incapable of reversing the slump. Continue reading...

items.title: West Ham close in on Gil Vicente‚Äôs Pablo after going cold on J√∏rgen Strand Larsen
items.summary: Costs for Strand Larsen high, with Wolves wanting ¬£40m Gil Vicente‚Äôs Pablo has nine goals in Portuguese top flight West Ham are in advanced talks over a deal for the Gil Vicente forward Pablo after having second thoughts about bidding for the Wolves striker J√∏rgen Strand Larsen. Nuno Esp√≠rito Santo, whose side are at major risk of relegation from the Premier League, wants attacking reinforcements and club sources indicated on Tuesday that an opening offer for Strand Larsen was being prepared. However, there is a scattergun feel to West Ham‚Äôs recruitment and they have developed cold feet over the finances around Strand Larsen. Wolves want ¬£40m for the Norwegian, whose wage demands are high. Continue reading...

items.title: Not just results - why Maresca is under pressure
items.summary: Chelsea boss Enzo Maresca needs results to improve but issues off the pitch are adding to the pressure, BBC Sport's Nizaar Kinsella explains.

items.title: Everton wrongly denied penalty in Arsenal loss, says panel
items.summary: Everton should have been awarded a penalty in their 1-0 defeat by Arsenal, the Premier League's Key Match Incidents Panel has said.

items.title: Maresca in danger of losing Chelsea job if results do not improve in January
items.summary: Enzo Maresca will have to improve results at Chelsea quickly if he wants to keep his job after a run of one win in seven Premier League games.

items.title: Loughnane chalks up record-breaking 222nd win of the year
items.summary: Billy Loughnane broke the 21st century record for winners in a calendar year after he registered his 222nd success on Invited at Lingfield Park on New Year‚Äôs Eve.

items.title: Napoli say Rasmus H√∏jlund‚Äôs permanent move from Manchester United a ‚Äòformality‚Äô
items.summary: Striker has nine goals since joining on loan Champions League qualification brings obligation to buy The Napoli sporting director, Giovanni Manna, considers Rasmus H√∏jlund‚Äôs permanent transfer from Manchester United a ‚Äúformality‚Äù. H√∏jlund joined the Serie A champions on loan last summer and the Denmark striker has scored nine goals in 20 appearances, including a double in Sunday‚Äôs 2-0 win at Cremonese. Napoli are third in Serie A, occupying one of Italy‚Äôs four Champions League places. Continue reading...

items.title: 'Are you sure?' - Guardiola questions two-horse race
items.summary: Pep Guardiola has questioned whether the Premier League title race this season is a two-horse race between his Manchester City side and leaders Arsenal.
